alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Grady; Mitchell; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 15 at 10:54AM EDT until June 15 at 11:45AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Decatur County in southwestern Georgia... Northern Grady County in southwestern Georgia... Southeastern Mitchell County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Thomas County in south central Georgia... * Until 1145 AM EDT. * At 1053 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bainbridge, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cairo, Pelham, Bainbridge, Ochlocknee, Whigham, Climax, Akridge, Grady Co A/p, Capel, Elpino, Harrells Still, Peoples Still, Spence and Quality. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EDT for south central and southwestern Georgia. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EDT for south central and southwestern Georgia.
